DataElement.preferredName: Acute Graft Versus Host Disease Skin Involvement Maximum Severity Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A description of the maximum severity of acute graft versus host disease skin involvement.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Acute Graft Versus Host Disease Skin Involvement Maximum Severity
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A syndrome of immologically mediated tissue damage occurring following allogeneic transplant usually affecting the skin, liver, and gi tract.  Onset is usually within one hundred days of transplantation or immunologic manipulation._An organ that constitutes the external surface of the body.  It consists of the epidermis, dermis, and skin appendages._To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process._The largest possible quantity or degree._Used of the degree of something undesirable e.g. pain or weather; also, strictness.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Acute Graft Versus Host Disease Skin Involvement
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A syndrome of immologically mediated tissue damage occurring following allogeneic transplant usually affecting the skin, liver, and gi tract.  Onset is usually within one hundred days of transplantation or immunologic manipulation.:1. An organ and the enveloping membrane of the body; includes, in addition to the epidermis and dermis, all of the derivatives of the epidermis, e.g., hairs, nails, sudoriferous and sebaceous glands, and mammary glands. Subdivisions of the skin surround various body parts; as a whole, the skin constitutes the external surface of the body. 2. The rind, capsule, or covering of any body or part.:To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process.

Concepts.definition: A syndrome of immunologically mediated tissue damage that may occur following an allogeneic transplant, usually affecting the skin, liver, and GI tract. The onset is usually within one hundred days of transplantation or immunologic manipulation.
An organ that constitutes the external surface of the body. It consists of the epidermis, dermis, and skin appendages.
To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process.

Property.preferredDefinition: the largest possible quantity or degree.:Severity; used of the degree of something undesirable e.g. pain or weather.

Concepts.definition: The largest possible quantity or degree.
Used of the degree of something undesirable e.g. pain or weather; also, strictness.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

It consists of the epidermis, dermis, and skin appendages._Used of the degree of something undesirable e.g. pain or weather; also, strictness._Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Generalized erythroderma with bullae formation and/or desquamation
No rash, no rash attributable to acute GVHD

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

An organ that constitutes the external surface of the body. It consists of the epidermis, dermis, and skin appendages.

ReferenceDocuments.name: BRIDG mapping for CDE:2797618
ReferenceDocuments.description: PerformedObservation > PerformedClinicalInterpretation.value WHERE PerformedObservation > DefinedObservation.nameCode = "assess severity" AND PerformedObservation.targetAnatomicSiteCode = "skin" AND PerformedObservation > AssessedResultRelationship > PerformedDiagnosis.value = "GVHD" AND PerformedDiagnosis.diseaseStatusCode = "Acute"  AND AssessedResultRelationship.typeCode = "assessment"
